name: 青少年心理學研究
description: This course will follow the development of youth from pre-adolescence to late adolescence. We will explore the nature of adolescent development in terms of biological, cognitive, social, and emotional development. How the social contexts of peers and families affect the psychological well-being of adolescents will be considered. Emphasis will be placed on theory and research as sources of knowledge. By the end of the semester, students should arrive at a better understanding of how biological and social factors play a role in adolescent development.
goals: To acquire fundamental knowledge of Adolescent Psychology
To develop related skills to conduct research in Adolescent Psychology
To appreciate and respect the diverse perspectives in Adolescent Psychology domain
syllabus:
²  Nature of adolescent development

²  Physical development

²  Cognitive development

²  Social-emotional development

²  Contexts of adolescent development

Risk & resilience in adolescence
